TopicTitle: How well would these laptops run KSP?

Articles.Content:
On best or medium settings with a few mods.

http://m.bestbuy.com/m/e/product/detail.jsp?skuId=9041061&pid=1218974707060&pcatId=abcat0502000

http://m.bestbuy.com/m/e/product/detail.jsp?skuId=1503828&pid=1219052906633&pcatId=abcat0502000

http://m.bestbuy.com/m/e/product/detail.jsp?skuId=9849775&pid=1219043331741&pcatId=abcat0502000

AFAIK they should all be fine. The last one is your best option because of the graphics chip; I don't know how the other two will do for graphics. I'm running an i3 laptop with 6GB RAM and a Radeon 6750, it does pretty well so long as you're not overloading the scene. Two or three craft is about all it can handle well, although it was still fairly smooth, if slow, docking to a 300+ part space station.

None of them are very good; all feature Integrated graphics and midrange processors.

Intel ones (first two) have a faster processor, the AMD one (third) has a better GPU. All are marginal. Sure, they'll run KSP, but will struggle when you start piling mods and bumping up graphics. If I would have to choose out of those three, I would pick the third due to the best GPU but honestly I would not accept any of them.

regex's HD 6750 GPU is many times faster than any of the graphics chips integrated into these laptops.

I play KSP on my laptop, it's an Intel Core2 Duo with 4Gb of RAM and an ATI Radeon 4650 integrated card. That third laptop is a step up from mine so it should be fine. I have my settings down low and I don't run any mods at all so maybe your mileage will differ.

HTH - Malloy
